meanings.sent1: After the long hike, my legs felt achiest of all.
meanings.sent2: Her achiest joints were her knees after playing soccer.
meanings.sent3: The achiest chair in the waiting room made everyone shift uncomfortably.
meanings.sent4: The old, achiest tree in the forest stood tall despite its pain.
meanings.sent5: The achiest toothache kept him up all night, throbbing relentlessly.

meanings.definition: Experiencing the most pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The patient looked the achiest when waiting for the doctor.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the roof sounded achiest with every gust of wind.
meanings.sent3: The achiest part of the movie was when the hero almost lost the battle.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt achiest when saying goodbye to her best friend.
meanings.sent5: The achiest memory was the one that brought tears to his eyes every time.
